title: Item Set Mass Removal
body:
I used to use Lol Summoner Info(commonly known as LSI) for stuff like Replays and Item Sets.
Those are now officially added to the client, neat.
But because of the automatic way it added item sets based on average play with each champion, I probably have over a hundred different item sets.
Unfortunately, the client has a limit of 20 item sets, and I can't make any more until I delete them.
But I'm only allowed to delete one at a time.. and each deletion takes a solid 5+ seconds.

Honestly I would almost rather reinstall League if I thought it was a file-based thing that would help.

replies.body:
I have a much easier way you can get those all deleted at once. 

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to your config files (Default location is C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config)
- Find the file "ItemSets.json"

Deleting that file should erase all of your item sets. Make sure that you're logged into the game when you delete it, otherwise, when you log in, the client will re-download those item sets.

Hey! Thanks for your response.

When you say to make sure I'm logged into the game, you mean at the main menu of the client, with the Overview, Patch Notes, etc.?

I tried that, but it still redownloads the item sets when I log in. :/
